posts.cooked:
Hello CD ,

My team’s been having a very strange issue with our robot’s connection to networktables and, because of that, our dashboards. When we initially connect, and the next 5 minutes afterwards, we’re fine. Then we start quickly losing and regaining connection to networktables in quick succession, making any dashboard unuseable (See attached GIF). This includes Shuffleboard, Smartdashboard, Advantagescope and Elastic.

WPILib has been updated to 2024.3.1, driverstation is 2024.1, and the RIO 2.0 image is 2024_v2.2. Here is a link to our code if needed.

link_counts.title: GitHub - TitaniumTitans/2024Crescendo: FRC team 4467 Titanium Titan's 2024 FIRST In Show code.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Generally the cause of this is high CPU utilization starving the NetworkTables server thread from keeping up with incoming data.  Do you have coprocessors or a lot of other processing happening?
This happens even when the orange pi is powered off and not plugged in.
Like @HollywoodINC said, we have an Orange Pi running Photonvision, but this was happening both before and after we had it plugged in.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
I’m virtually certain it’s CPU load related, but if you collect more data for me, it can help me look into the issue to confirm.  Add this code (or something similar to it that uses the AdvantageKit data log instead of the DataLogManager one) to your robotInit:

This will put debug-level info from NT into the wpilog file on the robot.  If you reproduce the issue and send me the log I can look into it further.

We had been running AdvantageKit but weren’t using any of the replay tools, so I removed all of AdvantageKit from our code and it seems to be running a little better. That being said, I did add that code snippet and have a log file. What would be the best way to send it to you, as CD doesn’t support sending WPILib log files.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Google drive?  You can PM me a link.
